[Learn more here.](https://help.appsumo.com/article/728-partner-verification) ## Unified AI sales solution Kevin Kariuki spent a decade leading B2B sales teams and witnessed first-hand how juggling half a dozen point solutions drained the most productive reps. He founded Nexuscale to flip the script on tool sprawl, designing an integrated AI-driven platform that replaces fragmented sales stacks. Nexuscale’s autonomous agents continuously discover ideal prospects, deeply research contacts, and generate hyper-personalized outreach at scale. By streamlining the entire prospecting and outreach workflow into a single solution, Nexuscale frees teams to focus on closing deals instead of managing tools. [![Kevin Kariuki](https://s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/static.appsumo2/media/users/avatars/carousel.png?width=80&height=80)](https://appsumo.com/profile/Kevin_Nexuscale/) [Kevin Kariuki](https://appsumo.com/profile/Kevin_Nexuscale/) [![See Kevin Kariuki on LinkedIn](https://appsumo.com/_next/image/?url=%2Fbrands%2Flinkedin-icon.png&w=48&q=75)](https://www.linkedin.com/in/kevin-kariuki-global) Founder ## Insider Knowledge FAQs, questions, reviews, and updates from the founders—everything you need in one place. Open What makes Nexuscale different? Most tools give you fragments—lead databases, AI writers, email senders. Nexuscale is one autonomous sales agent that handles everything: finds prospects, researches them, writes outreach, and runs sequences. One AI teammate for your entire outbound motion. ##### Can this replace my SDR? Open Can this replace my SDR? For most teams, yes. You'll get SDR-level output at ~10% of the cost, 24/7. Many customers delay hiring for 6–12 months—or give each rep their own AI prospecting machine. ##### What are the key features of Nexuscale AI? Open What are the key features of Nexuscale AI? Nexuscale AI offers features such as access to over 450 million verified leads, AI-driven personalized outreach via email and LinkedIn, and an AI Co-Pilot that provides real-time insights to prioritize deals and track progress. ##### Do you offer Onboarding help? Open Do you offer Onboarding help? Yes. All plans include fast setup. Scale+ and Enterprise include dedicated success managers and strategy sessions. ##### Wll my emails reach the inbox? Open Wll my emails reach the inbox? Yes. You manage warm-up, we handle the rest. Our AI writes natural, contextual emails that avoid spam filters and get replies—no templates. ##### What results can I expect? Open What results can I expect? Week 1: qualified leads flow in. Month 1: 3-5x higher reply rates vs. traditional outbound. Why? We target real buying intent with research backed personaliztion. ##### Is my data secure? Open Is my data secure? Yes. Enterprise-grade security, SOC 2 in progress. Your data stays private—never shared. Our database is built by aggregating signals and business data from multiple sources, including LinkedIn, company websites, public filings, funding announcements, hiring data, and news. That said, I want to be transparent: today, our coverage is strongest in broad B2B markets (SaaS, agencies, consultancies, tech, etc.). For niche verticals like perfumeries, boutique hotels, florists, and SPAs, we don’t yet have deep coverage in our database, though we’re expanding industry by industry. In the meantime, you can upload your own contact lists (unlimited) and Nexuscale will still handle the research, enrichment, and personalized outreach for you. That way, your agents can actively work your exact target market while our broader database keeps growing. Export options: You can export enriched lists to CSV with all available fields, including emails, phones, company, and role. Setup was quick and seamless, and within hours I was able to explore the platform, find relevant contacts, and even launch my first campaign. The interface is sleek and intuitive, making it easy to get productive right away. What impressed me most was the quality of the AI-driven outreach. Instead of generic templates, each email felt natural and personal, reflecting real context pulled from company signals. Add to that the continuous discovery of potential customers, and it quickly became clear how much time this tool can save. I also appreciate the option to approve campaigns before they go out, giving me full control over my outreach. Support has been excellent. The chat team has been responsive and helpful whenever I’ve needed guidance, and Kevin, the CEO, personally took the time to answer my questions with clarity and vision. It’s rare to find leadership so directly engaged and a team so committed to their users. While there’s still room to grow with features like LinkedIn outreach and multi-workspaces, the foundation here is strong, and the pace of development is fast. I’m confident in the decision to use Nexuscale and excited to see how it continues to evolve. However, after using it for several weeks, my experience has been full of frustration. While Nexuscale offers innovative features, its execution is marred by persistent bugs, poor localization, and a lack of reliability. Here’s my detailed review. 1\. Credit System Chaos The Problem: Nexuscale’s credit system is flawed. Uploading a CSV file of 60 leads deducted 60 credits from my account, even though I didn’t use the app’s target search tool. This happened repeatedly, forcing me to contact support for manual resets. Why It Matters: Credits are a core part of Nexuscale’s pricing model. If you can’t trust the system to track usage accurately, you’ll constantly worry about running out of resources mid-campaign. 2\. Poor Database Coverage outside the U.S The Problem: Nexuscale’s lead database is heavily skewed toward the U.S. When I filtered for New Zealand-based leads, the results were sparse and often irrelevant. Why It Matters: If you’re targeting a niche or non-U.S. market, you’ll likely need to rely on your own lead lists. 3\. AI Uses Inappropriate News for Outreach The Problem: One of the most concerning issues was the AI’s tendency to reference negative or irrelevant news about a prospect’s company in outreach emails. For example, it pulled in articles about lawsuits, safety concerns, or financial troubles and used them as conversation starters. This approach felt tone-deaf and unprofessional, especially when reaching out to potential clients. I had to manually review and rewrite every email to avoid sounding insensitive or out of touch. Example: The AI generated an email mentioning a recent lawsuit against a prospect’s company, framing it as a reason they needed my photo booth services for their staff party. Not only was this irrelevant, but it also risked offending the recipient. Why It Matters: Using negative news in cold outreach can damage your credibility and relationship with prospects. The AI should focus on positive or neutral topics, or at least allow users to exclude certain types of content. 4\. Time Zone Mayhem The Problem: Scheduled emails displayed inconsistent time zones, making it impossible to plan B2B outreach effectively. Why It Matters: Sending cold emails at odd hours kills open rates. The lack of a clear time zone selector was a major oversight. 5\. Formatting and Deliverability Issues The Problem: Emails sent via SMTP lost all formatting. Bullet points turned into jumbled text, signatures disappeared, and HTML elements (like logos) failed to render. The AI also insisted on using long dashes (—) mid-sentence, which looked unprofessional and increased spam risk. Why It Matters: Poorly formatted emails hurt your brand’s credibility and deliverability. 6\. Missing Critical Features No Logo Support in Signatures: The signature editor only supports text, so I couldn’t add my company logo. This was partly solved by adding HTML feature, but ending not showing on the emails sent anyway. Limited AI Customization: The AI ignored prompts to avoid certain phrases or formatting styles. 7\. Buggy CSV Imports The Problem: Importing leads from CSV should be simple, but Nexuscale mislabeled fields. For example, it only allowed matching URLs to a “website” field (intended for personal sites), not company URLs. Why It Matters: If you’re not using Nexuscale’s built-in lead search, you’re stuck with half-baked functionality. 8\. Test Emails That Never Arrived The Problem: The “Send Test Email” feature failed repeatedly. I’d click the button, but nothing arrived in my inbox (or spam folder). Why It Matters: Testing is critical before launching a campaign. Without it, you’re flying blind. Avoid It If: You’re outside the U.S. or targeting niche markets. You rely on cPanel or other non-Gmail/Outlook email providers. You need reliable scheduling, formatting, or credit tracking. Final Verdict: Wait for Improvements Nexuscale has the potential to be a great tool, but it’s far from ready for prime time. Every single feature is either buggy or not working. Results can be disastrous if you start sending campaigns without checking the content and the formatting before hand. The interface is clean, and the support team is responsive, but the bugs and missing features make it feel like an, alpha product. Right now it is unusable, I’d recommend holding off until the development team irons out the kinks. Edit: True, they fixed things Few things tested after Kevin's comment: Email sample: "I saw the recent news about the troubling incident at a Brisbane Airbnb, which highlights the importance of safety and memorable experiences in hospitality. It reminds us how crucial it is to create positive, secure environments for guests and staff alike." Time, not fixed. only a few time zones, but some are incorrect Email formatting not fixed, nor is the signature Test email not working Read less Founder Team ![Kevin_Nexuscale](https://appsumo2-cdn.appsumo.com/media/users/avatars/carousel.png?width=150) Kevin\_Nexuscale Sep 30, 2025 Hi Matt, We read your extremely detailed review and thank you for your persistence, the time you spent with our support team was invaluable to our development over the last few weeks. Your unique setup (heavy CSV use, custom SMTP, wanting to complex formatting over cold emails, and international targeting) exposed critical conflicts that we needed to address immediately. We are pleased to confirm that we took aggressive action, and the Nexuscale platform you log into today is vastly more stable than the version you reviewed. Critical Issues Resolved Based on Your Feedback We have successfully addressed and resolved the core stability and trust issues you identified: AI Used Negative News: This was our most critical fix. We deployed an AI Sentiment Filter to exclude all negative company news, ensuring personalization is strictly positive or neutral. Email Sending/Formatting: FIXED. We have optimized our system to better accommodate the varied configurations of self-hosted cPanel servers, resolving the bug that caused formatting and signatures to disappear. (Note: We still advise against using bullet points in cold emails, as they can independently increase spam risk.) Credit System Chaos: FIXED. The bug causing credits to be incorrectly consumed by CSV imports is resolved. Your credit tracking is now reliable. Time Zone Mayhem: FIXED. We completed the overhaul of our scheduling infrastructure to provide reliable, comprehensive global time zone support. Data Importing (URLs): FIXED. We've had dedicated field for Company Website/URL to ensure the AI correctly reads and uses data from all your imported leads. Missing Kill Button & Merge Tags: FIXED. Both the "Stop" button(has been live for 2 weeks) for scheduled campaigns and the intermittent failure of the {{leads\_first\_name}} merge tag are resolved. Test Emails Never Arrived: FIXED. The "Send Test Email" feature is now stable and working as designed. We understand why you felt the platform was unusable at the time of your review. We are confident we have rectified the issues exposed by your high-demand workflow. We’d genuinely appreciate it if you logged in to see the massive stability improvements firsthand. Unified AI sales solution

Kevin Kariuki spent a decade leading B2B sales teams and witnessed first-hand how juggling half a dozen point solutions drained the most productive reps.

He founded Nexuscale to flip the script on tool sprawl, designing an integrated AI-driven platform that replaces fragmented sales stacks.

Nexuscale’s autonomous agents continuously discover ideal prospects, deeply research contacts, and generate hyper-personalized outreach at scale.

By streamlining the entire prospecting and outreach workflow into a single solution, Nexuscale frees teams to focus on closing deals instead of managing tools.

Kevin Kariuki
Founder

Insider Knowledge

FAQs, questions, reviews, and updates from the founders—everything you need in one place.

Have a question?

Here you'll find a curated collection of frequent questions and answers, designed to provide you with quick, clear information about the product.

For all other questions refer to the questions tab

What makes Nexuscale different?
Most tools give you fragments—lead databases, AI writers, email senders. Nexuscale is one autonomous sales agent that handles everything: finds prospects, researches them, writes outreach, and runs sequences. One AI teammate for your entire outbound motion.
Can this replace my SDR?
For most teams, yes. You'll get SDR-level output at ~10% of the cost, 24/7. Many customers delay hiring for 6–12 months—or give each rep their own AI prospecting machine.
What are the key features of Nexuscale AI?
Nexuscale AI offers features such as access to over 450 million verified leads, AI-driven personalized outreach via email and LinkedIn, and an AI Co-Pilot that provides real-time insights to prioritize deals and track progress.
Do you offer Onboarding help?
Yes. All plans include fast setup. Scale+ and Enterprise include dedicated success managers and strategy sessions.
Wll my emails reach the inbox?
Yes. You manage warm-up, we handle the rest. Our AI writes natural, contextual emails that avoid spam filters and get replies—no templates.
What results can I expect?
Week 1: qualified leads flow in. Month 1: 3-5x higher reply rates vs. traditional outbound. Why? We target real buying intent with research backed personaliztion.
Is my data secure?
Yes. Enterprise-grade security, SOC 2 in progress. Your data stays private—never shared.

Expected to respond within 24 hours

Q: Database / Leads Source?

Dear Kevin,
We are targeting buyers at small perfumeries, design-led boutiques, high-end florists, SPAs, boutique hotels and similar stores. Does your database contain these?
How do source the B2B leads in your database? Is it mainly linkedin?
Many thanks for clarifying.
Pairfum London

www.Pairfum.LondonPLUSSep 22, 2025
See detail
Founder Team

Kevin_Nexuscale

Sep 22, 2025

A: Hi there,

Thank you for the thoughtful question. Our database is built by aggregating signals and business data from multiple sources, including LinkedIn, company websites, public filings, funding announcements, hiring data, and news. That’s what allows our agents to prioritize leads showing real buying intent rather than just static directories.

That said, I want to be transparent: today, our coverage is strongest in broad B2B markets (SaaS, agencies, consultancies, tech, etc.). Nothing works, you are doing the bug bounty for them

When I discovered Nexuscale on AppSumo, I was excited by its promise of AI-driven email campaigns, CRM integration, and smart lead targeting. However, after using it for several weeks, my experience has been full of frustration. While Nexuscale offers innovative features, its execution is marred by persistent bugs, poor localization, and a lack of reliability. Here’s my detailed review.

1. Credit System Chaos
The Problem: Nexuscale’s credit system is flawed. Uploading a CSV file of 60 leads deducted 60 credits from my account, even though I didn’t use the app’s target search tool. This happened repeatedly, forcing me to contact support for manual resets.
Why It Matters: Credits are a core part of Nexuscale’s pricing model. If you can’t trust the system to track usage accurately, you’ll constantly worry about running out of resources mid-campaign.

2. Poor Database Coverage outside the U.S
The Problem: Nexuscale’s lead database is heavily skewed toward the U.S. When I filtered for New Zealand-based leads, the results were sparse and often irrelevant.
Why It Matters: If you’re targeting a niche or non-U.S. market, you’ll likely need to rely on your own lead lists.

3. AI Uses Inappropriate News for Outreach
The Problem: One of the most concerning issues was the AI’s tendency to reference negative or irrelevant news about a prospect’s company in outreach emails. For example, it pulled in articles about lawsuits, safety concerns, or financial troubles and used them as conversation starters. This approach felt tone-deaf and unprofessional, especially when reaching out to potential clients. I had to manually review and rewrite every email to avoid sounding insensitive or out of touch.
Example: The AI generated an email mentioning a recent lawsuit against a prospect’s company, framing it as a reason they needed my photo booth services for their staff party. Not only was this irrelevant, but it also risked offending the recipient.
Why It Matters: Using negative news in cold outreach can damage your credibility and relationship with prospects. The AI should focus on positive or neutral topics, or at least allow users to exclude certain types of content.

4. Time Zone Mayhem
The Problem: Scheduled emails displayed inconsistent time zones, making it impossible to plan B2B outreach effectively.
Why It Matters: Sending cold emails at odd hours kills open rates. The lack of a clear time zone selector was a major oversight.

5. Formatting and Deliverability Issues
The Problem: Emails sent via SMTP lost all formatting. Bullet points turned into jumbled text, signatures disappeared, and HTML elements (like logos) failed to render. The AI also insisted on using long dashes (—) mid-sentence, which looked unprofessional and increased spam risk.
Why It Matters: Poorly formatted emails hurt your brand’s credibility and deliverability.

6. Missing Critical Features
No Logo Support in Signatures: The signature editor only supports text, so I couldn’t add my company logo. This was partly solved by adding HTML feature, but ending not showing on the emails sent anyway.
Limited AI Customization: The AI ignored prompts to avoid certain phrases or formatting styles.

7. Buggy CSV Imports
The Problem: Importing leads from CSV should be simple, but Nexuscale mislabeled fields. For example, it only allowed matching URLs to a “website” field (intended for personal sites), not company URLs.
Why It Matters: If you’re not using Nexuscale’s built-in lead search, you’re stuck with half-baked functionality.

8. Test Emails That Never Arrived
The Problem: The “Send Test Email” feature failed repeatedly. I’d click the button, but nothing arrived in my inbox (or spam folder).
Why It Matters: Testing is critical before launching a campaign. Without it, you’re flying blind.

Avoid It If:
You’re outside the U.S. or targeting niche markets.
You rely on cPanel or other non-Gmail/Outlook email providers.
You need reliable scheduling, formatting, or credit tracking.

Final Verdict: Wait for Improvements
Nexuscale has the potential to be a great tool, but it’s far from ready for prime time. Every single feature is either buggy or not working. Results can be disastrous if you start sending campaigns without checking the content and the formatting before hand. The interface is clean, and the support team is responsive, but the bugs and missing features make it feel like an, alpha product. Right now it is unusable, I’d recommend holding off until the development team irons out the kinks.
